description: The Samsung Galaxy Tab A 10.1 (2019) runs on Android 9.0 Pie, and sports a 10.1 inch IPS LCD 1200 x 1920 pixels Display with a 16:10 aspect ratio. The device is powered by an Exynos 7904 Octa 1.8 GHz 14 nm Octa-core processor, coupled with 2GB of RAM and 32GB of inbuilt storage which is expandable up to 400GB via microSD card. Galaxy Tab A 10.1 (2019) features a dual-camera setup at the rear, comprised of an 8-megapixel main sensor with an f/2.0 aperture, a 5-megapixel secondary sensor with an f/2.2 aperture and also comes with the Live Focus feature. description: The dual-SIM device Samsung Galaxy M10 runs on Android 8.0 Oreo, and sports a 6.22-inch HD+ (720×1520 pixels) Infinity V Display with a 19:9 aspect ratio. The device is powered by 14 nm Octa-core processor, coupled with 2GB of RAM and 16GB of inbuilt storage which is expandable up to 512GB via microSD card. The Galaxy M10 features a dual-camera setup at the rear, comprised of a 13-megapixel main sensor with an f/1.9 aperture, a 5-megapixel secondary sensor with an f/2.2 aperture and also comes with the Live Focus feature. The second camera enables 120-degree ultra-wide angle photography and can be selected through the camera app on the smartphone. Just fire up the 5MP Front Camera for lit selfies on your social feed with the In-Display Flash, selfie focus mode and f/2.0 aperture. The amazing M10 is available in two different colors; Charcoal Black, Ocean Blue. This device is unstoppable with 3,400 mAh battery under the hood and has an accelerometer, proximity sensor, virtual light sensor alongside Fast Face Unlock feature to unlock your phone quickly.
